Package seng202.group2.controller

Class DataExporter

java.lang.Object
seng202.group2.controller.DataExporter
Direct Known Subclasses:
CSVExporter
public abstract class DataExporter
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract class providing an interface for exporting crime data into a supported file type. This class has one static method used to get a DataExporter for a file, that is compatible with the desired file format. IMPORTANT: After using a DataExporter the close() method must be called to free up any resources reserved by opening files for writing, etc.
Author:
Connor Dunlop

  • Method Details

    • close

      public abstract void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Releases any resources reserved by opening files, etc. back to the operating system.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an error occurs trying to close the reserved resources.

    • getExporter

      public static DataExporter getExporter​(java.lang.String fileName) throws UnsupportedFileTypeException, java.io.IOException
      Gets a DataExporter instance that can parse data into the desired file type. Uses the suffix of the file path to determine the output file type, and consequently which DataExporter to use to export the data.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The path of the file to write exported crime data to.
      Returns:
      An instance of a DataExporter subclass which can export crime data to the desired file format.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedFileTypeException - If the file suffix does not match a supported file type
      java.io.IOException - If the provided file could not be opened for writing.

    • exportRecords

      public abstract void exportRecords​(java.util.List<CrimeRecord> records)
      Writes the supplied records to the file which this exporter is bound to.
      Parameters:
      records - An ArrayList of the crime records to write to the file.
